utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh my God, I love this chicken.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you know what they say, the best things in life are free.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you’re right, I eat your food a lot. How about this, you can raid my fridge any time you want.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that’s very kind of you. Next time I have a hankering to wash down a D cell battery with a jar of old pickle juice, I’ll come a-knocking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, Raj, you didn’t send your RSVP in. I’m supposed to ask you if you’re bringing someone to the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ll let you know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, can you make it soon. There’s a battle royale going on over the seating charts. In one corner, Bernadette’s mom, and the other three, mine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I hate wedding receptions. I wish the bride and groom would take a cue from Bilbo Baggins, slip on the ring, disappear and everyone goes home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmm, you liked Professor Guyster’s wedding.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They had a make your own sundae bar. Ooh, that was a night to remember. Do you know, on the one trip, I just had a bowl of nuts.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Anyway, you gotta let me know if you have a plus one, because if not my mom’s trying to sneak in the doctor who sucked the fat out of her neck.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Alright, uh, fine, I’m coming and I’m bringing somebody. Uh, Koothrappali plus one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who you bringing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Who are you bringing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: He’s bringing me. Who are you bringing?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow, what a bunch of Nosey O’Donnells.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, who is it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not telling. I’m from Asia. I’m mysterious. Deal with it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Howard, are you having a make your own sundae bar?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, uh, I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well you should. 50% of marriages end in divorce, but 100% of make your own sundae bars end in happiness.

utterance.speaker: Raj (on skype)
utterance.content: Hello Mummy, Daddy, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: Pretty good, can’t complain.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Oh I’m sure you can. Just give it a minute.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Listen, uh, there’s something I want to talk to you about. I, I wasn’t ready until now, but I think it’s time.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: It’s finally happening. You’re coming out of the closet, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: We love you, and we accept your alternate lifestyle. Just keep it to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I’m not gay. If anything, I’m metrosexual.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It means I like women as well as their skincare products.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Well, if you’re not coming out, why did you call us during the cricket semi-finals?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: ‘Cause I, I’m tired of trying to meet someone and, I think I’d like you to help me find uh, a wife.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: And just to clarify, a female wife?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: Matchmaking, very smart move son. Much better than marrying for love.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
utterance.content: We married for love.

utterance.speaker: Dr Koothrappali
utterance.content: And it’s been wonderful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Quantum physics makes me so happy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m glad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s like looking at the universe naked.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi, you guys got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I was thinking about Sheldon’s little joke the other night about me eating all your food.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that was no joke. But I understand your confusion as I am our group’s resident cut-up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you are our resident cut-up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Prove it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Knock, knock.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who’s there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interrupting physicist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Interrupting physi…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: MUON!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Anyway, I got a little residual cheque from my commercial and I thought, hey, how about I get the guys a little thankyou to pay them back. So, Sheldon, ta-da!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah! A vintage, mint in box, 1975 Mego Star Trek transporter with real transporter action. Hot-darn!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where did you get that?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, from Stuart at the comic-book store.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You went to the comic-book store by yourself?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it was fun, I walked in and two different guys got asthma attacks. Felt pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well this calls for an expression of gratitude.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ooh, am I about to get a rare Sheldon Cooper hug?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not this time. Then they wouldn’t be special. Thanks Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re welcome. Don’t worry, I didn’t forget about you. Leonard, I got you a label maker.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow. No, it’s great. Also, uh, mint in box.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm. And, I got you a transporter too!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Awesome!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, it was actually designed for my vintage Mr Spock action figure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s great. Let’s open it up and put him in there.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh dear Lord. No!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why, they’re just toys?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They’re mint in box.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They’re Collectables.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: C’mon can’t we just open one up and take a…

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Once you open the box it loses its value.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, my mom gave me the same lecture about my virginity. Gotta tell you, it was a lot more fun taking it out and playing with it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you sure you want us here when you meet this woman?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh yes. In my culture it’s expected to have a chaparone to oversee a first date. Plus I want to make a good impression and, no offence, but with you guys here I look like six two.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The nuns always chaparoned the dances at my high school. They used to make us leave room between us for the holy spirit.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hindus do the same thing. Except they leave room for a cow.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Listen, I love your charming racist humour, but any chance you could not knock my religion while she’s here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yesterday you made fun of me for eating lox.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s different. You’re people don’t worship lox.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well clearly you’ve never been to brunch with my cousins.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, arranged marriages. The parents just decide, and then you have to get married?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, I get a say in it. But I’m sure whoever shows up will be better company than a threesome I’ve been having with Aunt Jemima and Mrs Butterworth.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Excuse me, are you Rajesh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yes. You must be Lakshmi. Uh, nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Nice to meet you too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, uh, these are my, my friends. This is Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And this is Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please have a seat. I’m thinking double wedding!

utterance.speaker: Voice of Spock
utterance.content: Dr Cooper. Dr Cooper?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is someone there?

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Down here, on your desk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Spock?

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: I need to speak with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fascinating. The only logical explanation is that this is a dream.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: It is not the only logical explanation. For example, you could be hallucinating after being hit on the head by, say, a coconut.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Was I hit on the head by a coconut.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: I’m not going to dignify that with a response. Now, to the matter at hand. You need to play with the transporter toy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But it’s mint in box.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Yes, and to open it would destroy it’s value. But remember, like me, you also have a human half.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not going to dignify that with a response.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Consider this. What is the purpose of a toy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To be played with.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Therefore? To not play with it would be?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Illogical. Oh, damn it Spock, you’re right. I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Sheldon, wait. You have to wake up first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course. Set phasers to dumb, right? Goody, goody, goody. This is wrong. This is wrong. I’m so excited, but this is wrong. I’m gonna do it. I’m doing it. I did it. Oh, that’s what I always thought 1975 smelled like. One to beam down Mr Scott. Aye, aye, Mr Spock. Energise. . Energise. Don’t be broken. Please don’t be broken. What did you make me do? Okay, okay, think. It’s only logical.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: My goodness, that was delicious.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I hope you saved room for chocolate lava cake.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Impressive. What goes into making something like that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you start off by trying to make chocolate souffle, and when it falls you panic, quickly change the name, and voila! Lava cake.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: I bet our parents are dying to know how things are going here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, let’s see. Yup, three missed calls.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Four missed calls, two text messages, and a failed video chat. I win. So, what are we going to tell them.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like to tell them things are going well.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Me too. But before we get their hopes up we should probably make sure we’re on the same page.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, what page are you on?

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: I’m on the one where I’m on a lot of pressure from my parents to get married and settle down, and have a family, and I’m going to do it so they don’t find out I’m gay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Say again.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: I’m gay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like, dude on dude, but with women?

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: I know a fake marriage isn’t an honest way to live, but you of all people must know how difficult it is to come out in our culture.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why me, of all people?

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Well, there is a rumour back in New Delhi that you’re, how shall we say, comfortable in a sari.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not gay.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Really? The chocolate lava cake? The little soaps in the bathroom? And I’m sorry, but you’re wearing more perfume than I am.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s Unbreakable by Khloe and Lamar. And for your information, it’s unisex.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Fill in the blank. I love the nightlife?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I like to boogie.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: Got you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: W-w-with women. I like to boogie with women.

utterance.speaker: Lakshmi
utterance.content: That’s disappointing. You were exactly the kind of phoney-baloney husband I was looking for.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thankyou. And once again, my baloney likes girls. Wait-wait. You don’t want to put a bit of that in your mouth without trying my homemade chantilly cream. Yeah, okay, that time I heard it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh dear. Two suns and no sunscreen.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Hello again, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is it now, tiny Spock?

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: I am very disappointed in you. You broke your toy and switched it with Leonard’s. You should be ashamed of yourself.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re the one who told me to play with it.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: If I told you to jump off the bridge of the Enterprise, would you do it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. If I got on the bridge of the Enterprise, I would never, ever leave.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Trust me, it gets old after a while. You must right your wrong, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why? I got away with it. Leonard has his toy, and he’s never going to open it, so he won’t know it’s broken. And I have a toy that isn’t broken. Everybody’s happy.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Well I am unhappy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought where you come from they don’t have emotions.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: I come from a factory in Taiwan. Now do the right thing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what you are? Well, you’re a green blooded buzzkill. Perhaps it’s time you beam on out of here.

utterance.speaker: Spock
utterance.content: Fine. I will just use the transporter. Oh, right. You broke it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. Cooper to Enterprise, one to beam up. Energise. Ah. Tiny Spock. Help.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ready for lunch?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep, one sec. Ah, good. Ma would have killed me if she’d found out I’d broke my retainer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, uh, can I run something by you? It’s about Lakshmi.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Sure. How are things going?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We hit a couple of bumps. She lives over on Manhattan Beach, so it takes over an hour to get there. And she’s a lesbian.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What do you mean, she’s a lesbian?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you know whenever you and I would try to hit on women in bars, and they’d blow us off, and then we’d tell each other they were probably gay. It’s like that. Except this time it’s true.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Then why did she even go out with you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She was looking for a husband so she can appear to be straight. And you know, it sounded crazy to me at first, but I’m actually thinking about doing it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, well, so the reason that might sound crazy, is ’cause it’s crazy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look, Howard, you’re in a relationship. You know you have to make compromises.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, yes. But my compromises are about which bedspread to buy, or whose turn it is to do the laundry, Bernadette’s or my mom’s.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s a great deal. We both get our parents off our backs. I don’t have to come home to an empty apartment every night, plus, once I’m married, I can finally eat carbs again and let myself go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why don’t you tell your parents you want to try and find someone else, you know, maybe one who hasn’t slept with more women than you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Because this one wants to marry me. I might never find another one who does.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you’re seriously thinking about marrying someone you’re never going to have sex with.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I can’t believe your attitude. I thought you were in favour of gay people getting married.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, to other gay people.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you hear how homophobic you sound?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t want a broken toy. Nothing!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nothing. I said nothing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That was weird.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? I don’t even notice any more.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I cannot believe you guys aren’t going to play with these.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well I told you, you don’t, it’s mint in box.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I dunno. I just think it’s a waste. Relax. I’m just looking at the box.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perhaps you should look with your eyes, and not your muscular Nebraska man-hands.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is your problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My problem is that I don’t want you to break Leonard’s toy, which you probably did by shaking it. She shook it. We all saw her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, I bought you this because I wanted you to have fun with it. I don’t want it to just sit in this box.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, you’re right. I mean, it’s from you, I’m never going to sell it. I’m opening it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mmmmm!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s broken.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, nice job, man-hands.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I didn’t break it. I, I guess Stuart sold it to me like this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, he did, that is a perfectly satisfying and plausible explanation. Yeah, let’s all be mad at Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I paid a lot for this. Let’s take it over there and show him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait. It was me. I opened your toy, discovered it was broken and didn’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would you open mine?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t. That was a lie. I opened my own toy. And it was already broken so I switched them.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you should talk to Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t because that was a lie. Yours was broken in an earthquake. And that’s a lie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What is the truth?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My Mr Spock doll came to me in a dream and forced me to open it. And when the toy broke I switched it for yours. Later he encouraged me to do the right thing and I defied him. And then I was attacked by a Gorn.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, that I believe.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, Penny, I just, I want you both to know that I regret my actions toward the two of you. That’s a lie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, is that one mine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, hand it over so I can open it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Leonard, even though I don’t have one any more, I hope you have fun playing with it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And that’s a lie, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Big fat whopper. I hope it breaks.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is a treat, what brings you guys by?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Raj, Howie told me what’s going on with you and Lakshmi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What, you told her?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told everybody.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We believe there’s someone out there who’ll love you for you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, actually we kind of agreed to disagree on that one, but we both think you shouldn’t marry this woman.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, while I’m waiting for this mysterious perfect match, who may or may not exist, I’m supposed to just be alone.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not necessarily. I think we’ve found someone for you to cuddle with.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness. Aren’t you the cutest little Yorkie ever? You got him for me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Her. We thought you two would hit it off.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I think we already have. Thank you guys so much. Let’s see if you fit in my man purse.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Metrosexual my ass.
